page.title: 20Place Names And Origins
page.content: Many villages in this area contain the anglo saxon word of thorpe for example Chapelthorpe, a small hamlet with a chapel. Hollingthorpe, Holyn's village. Crigglestone means Crychills ton or the farmstead of Crychills. Micklethwaite Road is probaly named after Mayor James Micklethwaite of Wakefield 1850_1851. Mackie Hill was named after the Mackie Family who resided in Cliff House. Hall Green is named after the old vilage green at the end of Painthorpe Lane. Itwas thought that a Medievil village existed around the old green. The Fish Ponds Lane is derived from the Fish Ponds in the adjoining field. The Fish Ponds were owned by Chapelthorpe Hall and were in use from 1799-1850.
